result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan D Peterson

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Order of Commitment for Treatment

ec/pc: DA, Atty Huebner, DHS/MMHI, JESO (9/6/22--ma)
Proposed Order of Commitment for Treatment

3:01 PM. Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Bryan D Peterson appeared in-custody by video.  Attorney Karl E Huebner appeared by video for Bryan D Peterson.  Attorney Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews case history, status and filings including that a report was filed yesterday indicating that the defendant is not currently competent to proceed. 
Counsel decline to challenge the report or present further evidence. 
The Court presents basis for findings and orders including that the Defendant is not currently competent but is likely to become competent with treatment and medication. 
The Court orders the Defendant committed into the custody of DHS for treatment and medication.  The Court orders involuntary administration of medications. 
The Court finds and orders that the Defendant has 1 day credit for time served in this case. 
Scheduling addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Case continued for Review Hearing on 12/8/22 at 10am - the defendant may appear by Zoom in the defendant is in custody. 
Atty. Huebner to prepare and submit proposed orders. 
Recess 3:06pm. 

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.)
Review Hearing on 12/8/22 at 10am - the defendant may appear by Zoom in the defendant is in custody.
JA's Review of 07/05/2022 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (07/05) ML
Competency hearing on September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
ec/pc: DA, Atty Huebner, DHS/MMHI, Dodge County Detention Facility(6/27/22--ma)

[ma] Case called at 1:41pm 
.Attorney Karl E Huebner appears in court.   Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Bryan D Peterson does NOT appear (currently in custody at Dodge Co. Detention Facility)

The Court reviews court record. 
The Court advises parties that the court has attempted to facilitate an appearance by Mr. Peterson, but he is refusing to participate. 

Atty Huebner indicates that competency hearing in Dodge Co is on Monday; requests status thereafter

Atty Huebner will possibly be raising competency in this case. 


The Court finds that Mr. Peterson has been charged with 4th degree sexual assault and DC, repeater, the Court has made a probable cause finding.
Based on CCAP information, the Court raises competency.

The Court directs Clerk to draft order. 
recess: 1:50pm 
NEXT: Competency Hearing on 9/1/22 at 3:00pm
Scheduling Order
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

[ml] Case called at 10:46AM
Defendant Bryan D Peterson appears from the Dodge County Jail, in custody. Attorney Karl E Huebner appears in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement.

Upon Court inquiry, the Defense clarifies that it waives speedy trial demands as it pertains to this file.

Att Huebner advises that a competency examination has been ordered in a Dodge County file. Att Huebner clarifies, stating that he is not raising the issue of competency in this file as he has not spoken to the Defendant in some time.
The Court sets this file over for another Status Conference to allow for the Dodge County competency examination and hearing to proceed.

recess 10:49AM

NEXT: Status Conference on 06/24 at 1:30PM
Attorney Huebner
Attorney Huebner

Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on April 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
fax copy received poor quality
Fax Transmittal to Dodge County Jail with Bond for Administration
Notice of Court Order
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 11:36am 
Defendant Bryan D Peterson appears by telephone from the Dodge County Jail.  ADA Barbara Michaels appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Peterson indicates that he no longer lives at the N. Washington Street , Watertown address; he is not sure how long he will be in the Dodge County Jail.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given. After Mr. Peterson indicates that he wishes to have Public Defender counsel, the Court directs the clerk to notify the Jefferson PD Office to contact Mr. Peterson to apply for representation.
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered by the Court
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $2,500  Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no presence at the Super 8 Motel in Watertown 
--no contact with the individual identitifed as Victim 1 in the Victim Witness Key 

The Court indicates that Mr. Peterson will need to be booked the next time he is in the Jefferson County Jail.  
recess 11:45am

NEXT: (1) clerk is to email the Jefferson PD Office to request that they contact Mr. Peterson for an eligibility determination,  (2) Pretrial Conference on March 30th at 1:00pm,  (3) Status Conference on April 28th at 10:30am
